The reporter suggests removing the reflection usage by adding a private constructor to the class.", "OB": "The BidiUtil class in win32 uses Class.forName() to create a Callback object, which can throw a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT.", "EB": "To resolve this issue, I suggest adding a private constructor to the BidiUtil class. Since there are no nonstatic methods in the class, this change would prevent unnecessary instantiation of the class and improve code clarity. Additionally, adding a private constructor does not increase the size of the compiled code.", "SR": "1. Add a private constructor to the BidiUtil class.\n2. Ensure that the private constructor is properly implemented to prevent unnecessary instantiation of the class."}

{'id': '21706', 'title': 'Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage', 'description': 'Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage ', 'OB': 'Well, kind of.And so what if it does?OK, 2047 has a line in org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil of:static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4);The BidiUtil.class is syntactic sugar for Class.forName("org...BidiUtil").Theproblem with this is that method throws a NoClassDefFoundError, which is notdefined in the CLDC class libraries, which causes us a little problem in theCLDC version of SWT.You\'d only see this problem if you verified or usedjxeLink or something; the compiler gens the call itself, and just assumesNoClassDefFoundError is around, so you won\'t ever get a compiler error from theeclipse compiler (nor Sun\'s compiler).So, I\'d like this changed.Here\'s the simplest way to change to remove thereflection. ', 'EB': "add a private constructor.There are no nonstatic methods in this class, soactually, this would be a good thing to do anyway.Might as well preventpeople from instantiating the class if there's no need to.You're not addingany size, because the compiler gives you a free public constructor anyway.You're just making the contructor private instead of public. ", 'SR': ''}
